It's basically the digital version of what happens when he tells his son to clean his room.

articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: A new Artificial Intelligence system has been developed to predict Keratoconus patients with high risk of progressive vision loss with remarkable accuracy. It has been presented at the European Society of Cataract and Refractive Surgeons Congress. It analyzes Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) images of the cornea and other patient data to identify subtle changes indicative of disease progression. It's the first study of its kind to achieve this level of accuracy with scans and patient data.

The competitive landscape of AI is changing in ways that undermine the advantages of the biggest AI labs.
